intro: Euthamia microcephala, commonly known as golden tickseed, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy yellow blooms. The plant typically grows in open woodlands and prairies, thriving in full sun to partial shade. Its small, rounded flower heads are surrounded by pale green bracts, giving it a distinctive appearance. Euthamia microcephala is valued for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
